intro: Parosela fremontii var. saundersii, commonly known as the Fremont's parosela, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its botanical structure reflects adaptations to its native habitat, with a compact growth form and reduced water requirements.
